title: Who are some of today's most underrated or overshadowed artists in music? - Quora

response.answer_text: May not be your genre, but I grew up in Atlanta, and most of the popular hip-hop and rap that you hear ( per say 21 Savage or Future ) came with like a couple good mix tapes in the beginning but then now there just blathering on and on and on about the same stuff and repeating the same words. I think definitely the most overshadowed and possibly the some of the most underrated artists in that particular genre would be like the guys I grew up and went to school with who could hit a verse as fast as Busta Rhymes but never got listened to and got shut down by the guys with all the cash in the booths.

In terms of pure creativity, showmanship, and talent, I can’t think of anyone that tops Shakey Graves, so it always surprises me to find that many people have never heard of him. Guy can do it all: plays guitar like no one else, sings with an incredible tone and range, and plays a kick drum and tambourine with his feet while doing so. He’s also an impressive lyricist and songwriter, and has all but invented a genre of his own, playing at the intersection of southern rock, country, bluegrass, and punk. A couple of a my favorite tracks include Tomorrow, Late July, Roll the Bones, If Not for You, Dearly Departed, but he many other great tracks. Give him a listen!
